cyclone.name: ELSA
cyclone.current_location: about 100 mi (160 km) S of Camaguey, Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest across central-western Cuba Monday, emerging into the Florida Straits, then turning north-northwest and tracking just offshore of Florida’s west coast toward the Big Bend
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida west-coast (likely Big Bend/Tampa Bay area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical-storm and storm-surge watches posted from Flamingo northward to the Anclote River, Florida Bay and portions of the Keys (Craig Key–Ocean Reef)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical-storm warning in effect for the Florida Keys west of Craig Key to Dry Tortugas and much of Cuba (no Atlantic-side Florida warning yet)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire Florida Peninsula, greatest effects along Keys and west coast; lesser but still possible impacts over southeast Florida Atlantic coast including Port Everglades
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force gusts possible Monday night–Tuesday (peak 30–40 kt, 18 % chance sustained 34 kt)
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected on Atlantic side; main surge threat is Gulf coast
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches with locally up to 6 inches Monday–Tuesday could cause brief urban flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes Monday afternoon through Tuesday; hazardous seas and rip currents for inbound/outbound vessels
